title: [K-12] Rapid Prototyping-Based Curriculum for Online Information Literacy Enhancement

context.prior_knowledge: Basic information retrieval skills and experience utilizing academic resources
context.additional_context: Post-COVID-19 need for information literacy education optimized for non-face-to-face environments. Supports integrated online/offline learning to strengthen scientific research competencies.

learning_goals: Learners can systematically select five or more relevant scientific papers using keyword search strategies in online academic databases within 8 weeks.
Learners can complete an information analysis project—including peer evaluation—using collaboration tools in a blended learning environment.
Learners can design an information collection-analysis-visualization process tailored to their individual research topic using prototyping tools and improve it two or more times.

resources: Access to academic database in science fields
Collaboration tools (Google Workspace, Microsoft Teams, etc.)
Data visualization software (Tableau Public, RAWGraphs, etc.)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
